lexUnit.name: gleam.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a faint or brief light.

sentence.text: The gleam of insulating oil shone bright on the prominences of his face , dimming and brightening again as she moved past him to hunker down at his side .
Silhouetted against the gleam of the water human figures moved about .
Round the corner from the old jail , the Royal Hotel boasted a well inside the bar , the top covered by glass and the stone walls curving down into darkness and revealing a tiny gleam of water .
Inside the netted fruit cage Adam saw the bright , ripe , vermilion gleam of strawberries nestling among their triform leaves , raspberries yet green on the canes .
When they moved into the open countryside he saw fields and hedges , the broad gleam of a river .
There was the white gleam of bone as he smiled .
" Dear Miss Adeane , " and once again she saw that unpleasant gleam of white teeth against his dark face .
The night-light , burning steadily in its saucer , was unnecessary , its yellow gleam extinguished by the moonlight which streamed through the uncurtained windows .
Mrs Bean 's eyes held a gleam -- faintly malicious -- of humour .
Then Mr Plummer , a sudden gleam in his eye , said , ` How about a game of billiards , old chap ? "
Her voice faded away at the sardonic gleam in his eyes .
This time there was no denying the speculative gleam in his eye as he studied her figure through the folds of the towelling robe .
With a mad gleam in his eye , Pansy lobbed a small chunk of brown rock into the crucible .

He had already removed his jacket in the cloying warmth of the office but his white shirt was immaculate and as he reached across the desk Tom caught the gleam of gold cufflinks against the stiff white cuffs .
When you look at the beauty of the binding , and see the gleam of the 22kt gold inlaid on the spine !
None but he would have noticed the gleam of gold and diamonds -- the ring on the dead man 's finger as his hand broke the surface .
Rincewind saw the gleam of gold and bronze .
If he sees a gleam of light , it is in the clubs -- some of them anyway -- who tackle the tourists before they play Wales .
To my delight , dotted here and there on the leafy verge were gleams of light , a pale luminous shining in the warm darkness .
One rose , two roses , three roses … and , at the heart of the third rose , a gleam of light .
Her torch flickered across the wall and she switched it off , holding her breath in case someone had noticed the distant gleam of light .
I turned away , no longer able to face the eyes that looked at me so coldly in the gleam of the dashboard light .
There were huge boots , great sweeps of trouser , a mountain range of jacket and , far above , the distant gleam of electric light on a bald head .
